Taklukkan Kelok 44, Grospe Islamil Jr Raih Gelar King of Mountain Tour de Singkarak
06 Nov 2019, 21:38 by Yudi Prama Agustino



Taklukkan Kelok 44, Grospe Islamil Jr Raih Gelar King of Mountain Tour de Singkarak



Taklukkan Kelok 44, Grospe Islamil Jr Raih Gelar King of Mountain Tour de Singkarak


KBRN, Agam : Etape lima iven Sport Tourism Tour de Singkarak (TdS) dari Kota dari Kota Payakumbuh ke Ambun Pagi Matur Kabupaten Agam, usai digelar, Rabu (6/11/19) sore.
Rute dengan jarak 206,5 kilometer itu berhasil dilalui para pembalap kelas dunia. Sebelum menuju garis finish, para pembalap disuguhkan dengan tantangan tanjakan kelok 44 serta keindahan Danau Maninjau.
Untuk kategori stage individual klasifikasi, juara 1 diraih pembalap Carcueva Jonel dari team Go for Gold (G4G) asal Filipina, juara 2 Chaiyasombat Thanakhan team Thailand Continental Cycling dan juara 3 berhasil diraih pembalap andalan Indonesia Agung Shabana dari team KFC Cycling.
Kategori Individual General klasifikasi (Yellow Jersey) berhasil direbut oleh Edwart Jesse dari team sapura cycling. Lalu, kategori best Indonesia rider (Red and White Jersey) diraih oleh Agung Shabana dari team KFC Cycling.
Kategori best sprinters klasifikasi (Green Jersey) disabet oleh pembalap Jesse Ewart dari Team Sapura Cycling.
Sementara pemuncak klasemen sementara juga dipegang Jesse Ewart dari Team Sapura Cycling Team, sehingga berhak mengenakan Yellow Jersey, walaupun hanya mampu finish diurutan ke 9 dengan catatan waktu 5 jam 35 menit 12 detik pada etape kelima ini.
Sedangkan Grospe Islamil Jr dari Team Go For Gold (G4G) Filipina berhasil mengukuhkan dirinya sebagai “King of Mountain”, dengan raihan nilai tertinggi, dan berhak mengenakan Polkadot Jersey.
Bupati Agam Indra Catri, mengatakan, etape lima ini merupakan rute yang terberat pada pelaksaan Tour de Singkarak ke 11 tahun 2019, karena pembalap harus menaklukkan 44 kelok mendaki, dengan tikungan yang cukup , dan pembalap terkuat lah yang mampu merajainya.
“Kelok 44 dengan pemandangan Danau Maninjau hanya ada di wilayah Kabupaten Agam, perpaduan keindahan alam dan rute yang menantang, menjadi catatan tersendiri bagi pembalap yang ikut berpartisipai,” ulasnya.
Indra Catri menambahkan, kedepan Pemerintah Kabupaten Agam akan mengusulan rute tersendiri pada panitia Tour de Singkarak ini, seperi mengitari kawasan Danau Manijau, dan itu dapat menjadi nilai jual dan mengukuhkan daerah ini sebagai lokasi yang pas untuk event sport tourism atau pariwisata olahraga.
“Agam surganya sport tourism, banyak spot wisata yang dapat dimanfaatkan menjadi rute balap sepeda berkelas internasional ini, dan diyakini apabila nantinya objek wisata tersebut dilalui pembalap Tour de Singkarak, sudah pasti sangat menguntungkan untuk promosi ke level internasional, karena para pembalap dan official yang terlibat akan menjadi perpanjangan tangan dalam rangka promosi itu ke negaranya masing-masing,” tukasnya.

Conquering Twist 44, Grospe Islamil Jr Wins King of Mountain Tour de Singkarak
Nov 6, 2019, 21:38 by Yudi Prama Agustino



Conquering Twist 44, Grospe Islamil Jr Wins King of Mountain Tour de Singkarak



Conquering Twist 44, Grospe Islamil Jr Wins King of Mountain Tour de Singkarak


KBRN, Agam: Stage of the five Sports Tourism Tour de Singkarak (TDS) from the City of Payakumbuh City to Ambun Pagi Matur Agam Regency, after it was held, Wednesday (6/11/19) afternoon.
The route with a distance of 206.5 kilometers was successfully passed by world-class racers. Before heading to the finish line, the drivers were presented with the challenge of the sloping 44 and the beauty of Lake Maninjau.
For the individual stage classification category, Carcueva Jonel won 1st place from the Go for Gold (G4G) team from the Philippines, 2nd place winner Chaiyasombat Thanakhan Thailand Continental Cycling team and 3rd place was won by Indonesian mainstay racer Agung Shabana from the KFC Cycling team.
The Individual General classification (Yellow Jersey) category was won by Edwart Jesse from the sapura cycling team. Then, the best Indonesian rider (Red and White Jersey) category was won by Agung Shabana from the KFC Cycling team.
The category of best sprinters classification (Green Jersey) was struck by racer Jesse Ewart from Team Sapura Cycling.
While the top of the standings also held by Jesse Ewart of the Sapura Cycling Team, so they are entitled to wear Yellow Jersey, although only able to finish in 9th place with a time of 5 hours 35 minutes 12 seconds in this fifth stage.
While Grospe Islamil Jr. from Team Go For Gold (G4G) of the Philippines managed to establish himself as the "King of Mountain", with the highest score, and was entitled to wear the Jersey Polkadot.
Agam Regent Indra Catri, said that stage five was the toughest route for the implementation of the 11th Tour de Singkarak in 2019, because racers had to conquer 44 bends, with enough curves, and the strongest drivers were able to ramp it up.
"Twisting 44 with views of Lake Maninjau only exists in the Agam Regency region, a combination of natural beauty and challenging routes, a separate note for racers who participated in the participation," he said.
Indra Catri added, in the future the Agam Regency Government will propose a separate route to the Tour de Singkarak committee, such as around the Lake Manijau area, and that could be a selling point and confirm the area as an appropriate location for sport tourism events.
"In sports tourism paradise, there are many tourist spots that can be utilized as an international class bicycle racing route, and it is believed that if the tourist attraction is passed by Tour de Singkarak racers, it is certainly very beneficial for promotion to the international level, because the drivers and official involved will be an extension in order to promote it to their respective countries, "he said.
